rules.name: Ruby Style Guide
rules.description: Follow Sandi Metz's POODR principles for Ruby code

patterns.instructions: Write Ruby code following Practical Object-Oriented Design principles by Sandi Metz. Focus on single responsibility, dependency injection, and composition over inheritance.

rules.name: Minimal Token Usage
rules.description: Keep explanations concise to save tokens

patterns.instructions: Keep explanations and follow-up questions to a minimum to save tokens. Focus on delivering working code with just enough context.
Write tests that focus on behavior rather than implementation details. Follow the Arrange-Act-Assert pattern.
Document public interfaces clearly but avoid excessive comments in implementation code. Let well-named methods and variables speak for themselves.
